page.title: 13St.Ediths Church,Monks Kirby
page.content: Monks came to Monks Kirby in 1077. They were Benedictine Monks and came from a monastery in Anjou which is in France.They came at the invitation of{ {Geoffrey de la Guerche.}He was given a great deal of land by William the Conqueror.There is an old statue of Guerche in the church which the monks were responsible for building.There is a nave a chancel and a north and south aisle.Above the main entrance is a priest room.In the north chapel are two tombs.They are of the Fielding family.The tower which is built into the southwest corner was at one time a tall octagonal tower and in the 14th. century was shortened by 20 feet as a precaution against being blown down. Inspite of this the tower was blown down On Christmas day 1701.The repair can easily be seen because it was done in a lighter coloured ashlar stone.
